name: ORIPA ver. 1.62
body: Fix the bug of snapping, found in ver. 1.61.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.61
body:
* New input mode to make an incomplete vertex foldable if possible. Not automatically but user can select the solution from suggested endpoints. (proposed by @JinoBetti)
* Check of foldability around vertex is added. The algorithm is from a book “Geometric Folding Algorithms: Linkages, Origami, Polyhedra” by [Erik D. Demaine](http://erikdemaine.org/) and [Joseph O'Rourke](http://www.cs.smith.edu/~orourke/).
* A large refactoring is done. MVP based structure following the spirit of Passive View pattern.
* Window's behavior is slightly changed. Child windows such as foldability window will always close and re-open on re-calculation.

**Known bugs**
Some of snapping candidates do not appear.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.60
body:
* Scaling mode is added. Try Shift + S shortcut after selecting lines.
* Multiple crease patterns are supported. Now ORIPA can compute folded model and X-ray model for each crease pattern in one .opx.
* You can import other crease pattern data to the current project.
* You can paste copied (or cut) lines to anywhere. Of course snapping is still available.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.55
body:
* You can select end points when inputting a line on two vertices. (#165 , thanks @nisraf for suggestion!)
* Any input overwrites the line type of old overlapping lines. (#99 , @JinoBetti @lifesbest23 @Ooouch1)
* Bug fix.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.54
body:
* Further tuning on fold computation.
* Color config on folded model. (Proposed by @JinoBetti )
   * Note: the color data is saved as head of property's memo field. (Proposed by @lifesbest23 )
* Refinement of property dialog and folded-model UI. (@lifesbest23 and @Ooouch1 )
* Modal dialog while folding.
* Refactoring.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.53
body: Computation time for folding (or layer ordering of) a complex crease pattern is reduced, e.g., 9 minutes to 10~15 seconds.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.52
body:
* The search for finding correct layer orders gets faster.
   * Simple heuristic is introduced.
   * Computation time of penetration detection is reduced.
* New condition of penetration detection is added.
* Remove broken behavior of "invert" option in "Expected Folded Origami" window, which affected the view of "Folded Origami" window.
* Refactor the code.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.50
body:
* SVG export of expected folded model (by @JinoBetti)
* Perpendicular bisector input with end point selection
* Minor bug fix
* Refactor

name: ORIPA ver. 1.45
body:
* Change default selection of change line type "To" combo box.
* Draw aux lines first.
* New shortcut keys without Alt
* Use last directory of project file when exporting a file.
* Refactoring.
* Bug fix
   * We fix the CP in foldability window which followed changes in main window.
   * Empty pasting happened when Esc is pressed in copy-and-paste mode.
   * Centering SVG output of crease pattern was broken.
   * Experimental: fix bug of fold estimation algorithm. It can be slow.
   * Editing contour is broken.
   * FOLD-Export was slow for complex CPs.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.40
body:
The algorithms drastically changed to make the computation time short.
So this version might be buggy.
Feel free to report bugs if you find.

* New UI (by @lifesbest23)
* More variety of choices for changing line type "from" property
* "Any type" file filter for loading as default
* Remember the last path for saving folded model file.
* Bug fix:
	* Multi-line Deletion by "Change line type" didn't work correctly.
	* Escape key resets the all selections and the state.
* Fast computation:
	* Showing foldability window (the computation of OrigamiModel creation, finding line overlaps).
	* Adding lines.
	* Deleting lines.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.35
body:
* Implement test of (generalized) Big-little-big lemma.
* Accept unexpected line type value as "Aux" when loading .cp file
* Remove size normalization from .cp loading
* Show names of vertex violations
* Save configurations to oripa.ini
* Bug fix
  * Editing contour didn't work correctly
  * Deleting multi-lines didn't work correctly
  * DXF import/export for crease pattern
* Refactor

**Known fatal bug:**
* New user will fail to start ORIPA: ORIPA crashes if there isn't oripa.ini. This will be fixed in the next version.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.31
body: * Fix bug on loading .cp file and .pdf file.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.30
body:
* Redo by Ctrl + y.
* Line width can be selected (regular or zero). (suggested by @undertrox )
* Bug fix.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.25
body:
- Remove the assumption that the coordinate of the center of paper is (0, 0)
- Make the size of exported picture larger
- Move camera and zoom in/out in the check window
- Bug fix
- Refactor

name: ORIPA ver. 1.20
body:
* Aux lines are collapsed into the folded model like precreases. (by @undertrox)
* Highlight overlapping lines in the check window. (suggested by @undertrox)
* Angle snap input
* Anti-alias drawing on saved picture
* bug fix
* Refactor

name: ORIPA ver. 1.10
body:
- Anti-alias drawing
- FOLD format as a project file
- Accept [Enter] input for division number
- Kill the special treatment on cross point of aux and M/V.
- Move camera by left drag + Shift.
- Refactoring
- Minor bug fix

You need install JDK 11 or newer one.

name: ORIPA ver. 1.00
body:
* We fixed a bug that disabled inputting multi symmetric lines.
* You need install JDK 11. The code is revised to use the features of Java11.

name: ORIPA ver. 0.36
body:
# Release notes
* Bugs on undo in ver.0.35 are fixed.
* Faster access to line and vertex when selecting.
* This is an unstable version because the code has been drastically changed.
* You need JRE 7 or 8. If you have not installed JRE, you can use JDK 11.
